intro: Linanthus uncialis, commonly known as the silverleaf flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Linanthus uncialis is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
